identified-content.person: BARTLE, ELIZABETH LOUISA MASTERSON (ELIZABETH LOUISA MASTERSON CLAYTON)

block.p: Elizabeth Louisa Masterson Bartle, the daughter of Elizabeth Ward Bartle and Judge Harvey Bartle III, both of Philadelphia, was married yesterday to Austin Buck Clayton, a son of Dr. Cynthia C. Clayton and Dr. William F. Clayton of Orchard Park, N.Y. The Rev. Marek P. Zabriskie performed the ceremony at St. Thomas' Episcopal Church in Whitemarsh, Pa.
Mr. and Mrs. Clayton, both 29, graduated from Princeton, where they met in their freshman year.

Elizabeth Louisa Masterson Bartle, the daughter of Elizabeth Ward Bartle and Judge Harvey Bartle III, both of Philadelphia, was married yesterday to Austin Buck Clayton, a son of Dr. Cynthia C. Clayton and Dr. William F. Clayton of Orchard Park, N.Y. The Rev. Marek P. Zabriskie performed the ceremony at St. Thomas' Episcopal Church in Whitemarsh, Pa.
Mr. and Mrs. Clayton, both 29, graduated from Princeton, where they met in their freshman year.

The bride, who is known as Louisa, is a candidate for a master's degree in architecture from the University of Pennsylvania. Her mother is a reference librarian at Rosemont College in Rosemont, Pa., and a guide at the historic houses in Fairmount Park in Philadelphia. Her father is a federal district judge in Philadelphia.

The bridegroom is an associate in the Paris office of the law firm of Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton. He received a law degree magna cum laude from Boston University. His mother is a partner in East Aurora Pediatrics in East Aurora, N.Y., and an associate professor of pediatrics at the State University at Buffalo. His father is an allergist in Westfield, N.Y.
